  physical_appearance: This is a black metal safe. It is rectangular cuboid in shape
 with a door that swings outwards on the front. The front has a silver metal handle attached to it in the center
 beside a turn combination lock. Above it
 is a trademark inscription of the company. The door has a thin red border.

 Peng Kee Singapore. Ministry of Law

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This Samuel Withers safe was used by three political office holders at the Ministry of Law: Ms Indranee Rajah
 Associate Professor Ho Peng Kee and Mr Edmund William Barker. E.W Barker was a first-generation minister in Singapore’s post-independence cabinet who served as Minister of Law from 1964 to 1988. He was responsible for drafting Singapore’s separation documents in 1965 – an agreement to separate
 an amendment to the Malayan Constitution to allow Singapore to separate and the Proclamation of Singapore’s independence.

metadata.title_text: Samuel Withers Safe used by Ministry of Law
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black metal safe. It is rectangular cuboid in shape, with a door that swings outwards on the front. The front has a silver metal handle attached to it in the center, beside a turn combination lock. Above it, is a trademark inscription of the company. The door has a thin red border.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Safes Ho, Peng Kee Singapore. Ministry of Law Public records Barker, Eddie, 1920-2001
metadata.subject_terms_3: Indranee Rajah Barker, E. W. Ho, Peng Kee Singapore. Ministry of Law
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This Samuel Withers safe was used by three political office holders at the Ministry of Law: Ms Indranee Rajah, Associate Professor Ho Peng Kee and Mr Edmund William Barker. E.W Barker was a first-generation minister in Singapore’s post-independence cabinet who served as Minister of Law from 1964 to 1988. He was responsible for drafting Singapore’s separation documents in 1965 – an agreement to separate, an amendment to the Malayan Constitution to allow Singapore to separate and the Proclamation of Singapore’s independence.
